If the target character ever participates in a card-based challenge you initiate but do not succeed in, he takes a point of damage and you must discard this advantage.
Lore: Her big brown eyes seemed even more melting than usual.   She was apparently fool enough to think him susceptible...

Name: The Dragon Revealed
Effect: Replace Rand al'Thor character when you have 5 Pattern.  When you succeed in a card based challenge you initiated, draw 1 card.
Lore: ...on the breast of his dark cloak stood the same creature as on the banner, the four-legged serpent with the golden mane.

Name: The Dying Ground
Effect: Target a card-based challenge.  Only one terrain event may target each challenge.  If a monster takes damage while participating in that challenge, it takes an additional point of damage when the challenge is resolved.
Lore: I have heard they call the Three-Fold land the Dying Ground.  We hunt Trollocs, wetlander; they do not hunt us.

Name: The Great Game
Effect: You may pay [Politics Icon] as a limited event to place a reserve token on this card.  You may remove two reserve tokens as a limited event to add one [Politics Icon] to your pool.  This symbol has the allegiance(s) of your starting character.
Lore: It isn't a game at all Rand.  The nobles and the noble Houses maneuver for advantage.  They do things they think will help them, or hurt an enemy, or both.

Name: The Ruby Dagger
Effect: Target a character you control.  Any character that takes damage from the target and is not completely healed by the end of the turn is killed.  Roll a One Power die each ready round.  If you roll a [One Power Icon], place a corruption token on the target.  It is treated as damage, but cannot be healed.  As an event, pay [One Power Icon x2] to remove a corruption token or pay [One Power Icon x5] to discard this advantage.
Lore: This is from Shadar Logoth.  There is not a pebble of that city that is not tainted and dangerous...

Name: The Stone of Tear
Effect: If you control the Tear contested advantage, other players cannot add tokens to the Tear contested advantage except by using the challenge initiated by the Tear contested advantage.
Lore: She had heard of it in stories, heard that it was the greatest fortress in the world and the oldest, the first built after the Breaking of the World.

Name: The Telling Blow
Effect: Target a character or troop with damage participating in a challenge whose highest current ability is 1.  Put a point of damage on the target.
Lore: Suddenly the ship lurched, and a boom swung out of the shadows to catch the Trolloc across the chest with a crunch of breaking bones, sweeping it over the side.

Name: The Tide of Battle
Effect: If you succeed, this challenge becomes a player advantage targeting you.  Place one initiative token on it for each two you succeeded by.  You may rotate the advantage to remove any number of initiative tokens.  For each one removed, you may add a [Sword Icon] or [Shield Icon] to a card-based challenge.  Discard the advantage when there are no tokens remaining on it.
Lore: ... the tidal wave rushed on, closing holes and gaps apparently undiminished.

Name: The Truth They Tell
Effect: For every [Politics icon] [Politics icon] or [One Power icon] you pay from a character with the Aes Sedai allegiance, you may add one [Opposition icon] to a card-based challenge.
Lore: An Aes Sedai never lies, but the truth she speaks may not be the truth you think you hear.

Name: The Way of the Leaf
Effect: This card may only be played by a Hero player.  Target a character you control with no combat ability.  The target gains +2 Politics ability, but cannot gain combat ability or roll combat dice.  Any damage generated by the target is negated.
Lore: The leaf lives its appointed time, and does not struggle against the wind that carries it away.  The leaf does no harm, and finally falls to nourish new leaves.

Name: The Wheel Turns
Effect: Pay [One Power Icon x2] for each card-based challenge initiated this turn.  Only the Pattern challenge can add tokens to the Pattern this turn.
Lore: ...he claimed this struggle had gone on since the Creation, an endless war between the Great Lord and the Creator using human surrogates.

Name: The White Tower
Effect: If you control the Tar Valon contested advantage by 5 or more, you may rotate this advantage when you succeed at the Pattern Challenge to add a token to your section of the Pattern.
Lore: And over all rose one tower, higher and wider than all the rest, as white as the Shining Walls themselves.

Name: Thom Merrilin
Effect: Thom may pay [Intrigue Icon] [Intrigue Icon] [Intrigue Icon] as an event to force another player to discard a random card from his hand.
Lore: There was a time Thom Merrilin was Court-bard right here in Caemlyn, and known to every royal court from Tear to Maradon.

Name: Tight Formation
Effect: While a troop you control is the only troop you have participating in a given challenge, that troop gains +2 Combat ability.
Lore: ...trotting into the fields to halt beyond bowshot, a hulking black mailed mass, deep and stretching the length of the village.

Name: To The Victor
Effect: Whenever you succeed at a card-based challenge you initiated, draw 1 card.
Lore: But it's my bet they'll wait and watch, and come to you once Couladin is done for.  Victory settles a lot of arguments in most men's heads.

Name: Training for War
Effect: Target troop gains +1 Combat ability.
Lore: The Warder never seemed to blink, and the practice sword in his hands moved surely and smoothly as he flowed from one stance to another.

Name: Treaty
Effect: Choose an allegiance.  If you succeed, this challenge becomes a player advantage for you.  You may rotate this advantage as an event to generate one Politics symbol of the chosen allegiance.
Lore: We accept your conditions without reservation, Lord Bryne, and pledge ourselves to hold them.  They are most reasonable.

Name: Trolloc
Effect: The only cost to recruit this character is to rotate a character you control with the Dark One allegiance.
Lore: A tall, bulky shadow, and snouted... It lifted its snout as if sniffing.  Some of them hunted by scent.

Name: Trolloc Fist
Effect: One per turn, you may discard a trolloc troop you control from play to heal an amount of damage on the Trolloc Fist equal to the discarded troop's permanent Combat rating.
Lore: Trollocs with tusked boars' snouts or wolves' muzzles or eagles' beaks, some with heads horned or crested with feathers, wielded those oddly curved swords and spiked axes, hooked tridents and spears.

Name: Trolloc Footmen
Effect: When assigning damage from your opponent's troop damage pool, you may not place a point of damage on a non-trolloc troop until this troop has had a point of damage assigned to it.
Lore: Trollocs shrieked at the sudden light, but they did not stop swining their spiked axes and swords, curved like scythes.

Name: Trolloc Horn
Effect: Target a trolloc character you control.  Rotate this advantage as an event and pay [Combat Icon x2] to find the top trolloc (character or troop) in your deck.  Place it in your hand.
Lore: From the west came the keening wail of a horn.  Lan's head whipped around to stare back down the road behind them.  Rand felt a chill.

Name: Trolloc Raiders
Effect: When this troop is killed, draw a card.
Lore: A Trolloc can see better than a man in the dark, but bright lights blind them ... Some can track by scent or sound, but they're said to be lazy.

Name: Trolloc War Band
Effect: If you have a ready Myrddraal that is standing down in the battleground, this card gains Reinforcement.
Lore: In the days of the Trolloc Wars, Halfmen led the Trollocs in battle, under the Dreadlords.

Name: Twisting Fate
Effect: Target another player.  If successful, remove a token from his section of the Pattern.  The total number of tokens on the target's section of the pattern counts as automatic opposition to this challenge.
Lore: There is always room for small changes, but sometimes the pattern simply won't accept a big change, no matter how hard you try.

Name: Twists in the Pattern
Effect: Convert one of your Pattern tokens to a neutral token and target another player.  That player must also convert one of his Pattern tokens to a neutral token.
Lore: Yesterday, in this village the Pattern… moved, shaped itself around him like clay shaped on a mold.

Name: Two Rivers Archers
Effect: The Two Rivers Archers roll their dice during the Opening Moves step (instead of the Coming to Grips step).  Whenever the Two Rivers Archers take a point of damage, immediately apply an additonal point of damage to them.
Lore: A long column of farmers four abreast on horseback made the bulk of it... every one of them in Vilnar's sight had the longest bow he had ever seen.

Name: Unexpected Ally
Effect: Roll two Politics dice.  Add any [Politics Icon] you generate to your pool.  They have all allegiances.
Lore: I have given my entire life to the search for you, to find you and help you.

Name: Verin Sedai
Effect: While you control Verin, your maximum hand size is increased by one.
Lore: She was a plump, square faces woman, and even with the Aes Sedai gift of agelessness, there was a touch of gray in her brown hair.

Name: Wall of Fire
Effect: During the Opening Moves step of a challenge, target one participating troop for each [One Power Icon] you pay.  The targeted troops may rotate to stand down.  If they do not stand down, each troop takes as much damage as it rolls.
Lore: She pointed to the hollow between the hills, and flame gouted from the ground, a fountain twenty feet high.

Name: Wandering Noble
Lore: Who can say what turns a man of high birth against his own?  Debts and old scores, perhaps, or the accumulated stubbornness and squabbles of years.

Name: Ward of Protection
Effect: For each [One Power Icon] you pay, the cost for every other player to target you (or a card you control) with an event is increased by one [One Power Icon].
Lore: …much of that fire suddenly died or exploded short of any target, many of the lightning bolts stopped abruptly…

Name: Waygate
Effect: Select one of: your home front; a challenge; or standing down.  Target any number of characters and troops you control at the selected location.  Roll one Intrigue dice for each card targeted.  For each damage result rolled, kill one target.  The remaining cards reinforce one unresolved challenge.
Lore: Then darkness fell along the bridges.  Some who went in were never seen again.

Name: Weariness
Effect: If the target participated in a challenge last turn, he does not ready during the ready round.  The target's controller may pay two ability symbols of any type(s) as an event to discard this advantage.
Lore: Cloud stood head down, sides heaving.  Rand thought that Cloud would not be carrying anyone further that night.

Name: What Might Be
Effect: Convert one of your Pattern tokens to a neutral token.  Target an event card in your discard pile that is not the top event in that pile put the target card in your hand.
Lore: It was so real…  Was it real?

Name: Whispers in the Dark
Effect: This card may only be played by a Villain player.  Roll an Intrigue die for each token on your section of the Pattern.  Apply any [Sword Icon] or [Shield Icon] rolled (as appropriate) to a card based challenge of your choice.
Lore: Nobody ever sees him coming - he's just there all of a sudden, day or night, freezing you where you stand.  People are starting to look over their shoulders.

Name: Wolves
Effect: You must control a Wolfbrother to bring Wolves into play.  You must discard Wolves if you do not control a Wolfbrother.  Wolves gain +1 Combat while participating in a challenge against monster troops.  This troop cannot be the target of advantages.
Lore: Every wolf remembers the history of all wolves ... Wolves hate Trollocs and Halfman worse than wildfire ...
